Task 1:
Select 3 individual users from 3 separate user categories for your relevant
application and create Personas for the selected Users. (There should be at least
one novice user and one expert user).
A persona may contain (Content varies according to your function)
Body (name, age, picture)
Psyche (extrovert, introvert)
Background (Occupation)
Emotions and attitudes (towards the technology, information etc.)
Personal traits
Task 2:
Write the script for contextual inquiries. This can contain
A brief description of the background details of the selected user.
The questions you are going to ask the user.
The tasks you are going to give to the user.
Upload the Solution for Task 1 and Task 2 to the provided course web link.
Task 3:
Complete this task within this week.
Ask the user to do the tasks you listed in script you created in Task 2 and get a
video record of both the screen and the users’ facial expression.
While doing this instruct the user to follow the think loud protocol.
Think-aloud protocols involve participants thinking aloud as they are performing a set of
specified tasks. Participants are asked to say whatever comes into their mind as they
complete the task.
Refer the video below to get a brief idea about think loud protocol. Facial
expressions were not covered in this video, you must cover that as well.
